dublin_core.dcvalue: We investigated whether a distance therapeutic alliance occurs when children receive manualized cognitive behavioural treatment via telephone in the absence of face to face contact The therapeutic alliance scores were measured in 55 child parent pairs The mean total Working Alliance Inventory child scores were 236 95 confidence interval CI 232 240 and the mean parent scores were 245 95 CI 242 247 Parent scores were significantly higher than child scores although the difference may not be clinically meaningful This study provides evidence that a strong therapeutic alliance does occur between child coach and parent coach pairs when treatment is delivered from a distance by non professionals The term child encompasses both children and adolescents
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:16:31Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2008-07-17
A paediatric therapeutic alliance occurs with distance intervention.
